content: @Scott Morrison @Reid Barton Are we happy with this PR?

I'm happy, but was wondering if Reid was still concerned this definition should instead be:

class fin_enum (α : Type*) :=
(elems : list α)
(complete : ∀ x : α, x ∈ elems)
(nodup : list.nodup elems)
One of the goal of this definition was to help construct finite products from binary products in a constructive way. Does this seem to fit with the current state of the category theory library?
